intro: Koeleria gracilis var. latifrons, commonly known as the broad-fruited wiregrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as prairies and coastal dunes.
